description.narrative: The Prevention Up Front Alliance will implement a Planning, Monitoring, Evaluation and Learning framework based on an existing system currently used by GPPAC. In the process of learning, GPPAC has customised Outcome Harvesting as the network’s monitoring and evaluation system, which will inform the PME framework of the Prevention Up Front Alliance.

title.narrative: A Mid-Term Review Report was produced to assess results and progress of the work of GPPAC and WFM-IGP for the Prevention Up Front Alliance

description.narrative: During the first quarter of 2019 GPPAC finalised the Mid-Term Review (MTR) for the Prevention up Front Alliance. GPPAC and the Prevention up Front Alliance hired two Outcome Harvesting experts, Goele Scheers and Wolfgang Richert to harvest outcomes. This included improving of outcome statements, clarifying information provided and strengthening the underlying documentation that increase the credibility of the outcomes. From 2016 to October 2018 the PuF Alliance recorded 99 outcomes that the external evaluators found of sufficient credibility to analyse further. The findings and final recommendations were discussed with all Global Secretariat staff of GPPAC in February and with GPPAC’s Global Strategy Group in March for learning and strategic follow-up.
The Alliance contributes to enhanced civil society credibility by strengthening its networks' and members' accountability, complementarities and internal procedures and practices

title.narrative: Conduction of a Mid-Term Review for the Prevention up Front Alliance

description.narrative: During the fourth quarter of 2018 GPPAC executed the Mid-Term Review (MTR) for the Prevention up Front Alliance. GPPAC and the Prevention up Front Alliance hired two Outcome Harvesting experts, Goele Scheers and Wolfgang Richert to harvest outcomes. This included improving of outcome statements, clarifying information provided and strengthening the underlying documentation that increase the credibility of the outcomes.
3.2.2. The networks and members develop internal procedures to strengthen internal (network) and external accountability and take steps to implement them.

title.narrative: Key representatives from more than 30 CSOs and from the Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs (MFA) exchanged knowledge and experiences on Outcome Harvesting during a workshop in The Hague on 24 April 2018.

description.narrative: During the workshop, recommendations were developed for ensuring the quality of monitoring & evaluation practices for the Strategic Partnership grants. GPPAC produced a guidance note after the workshop and initiated an online platform and other support services for Outcome Harvesting practitioners. These activities were part of the project “Improving Practices in Outcome Harvesting” co-financed by the Knowledge Management Fund and the Prevention up Front partnership.
3.2.2. The networks and members develop internal procedures to strengthen internal (network) and external accountability and take steps to implement them.

title.narrative: New Outcome Harvesting database for GPPAC and the Prevention up Front Alliance project to process information on results from the Networks

description.narrative: GPPAC Global Secretariat developed a database in 2013 to keep track of the reported outputs (activity level) and outcomes (changes among actors that GPPAC influences). The database was revised and improved during 2017 and will be operational from the start of 2018 to keep track of progress and outcome results more efficiently.

title.narrative: GPPAC arranged that relevant staff of key actors in developing the Outcome Harvesting method will participate in the workshop of 24 April 2018.

description.narrative: GPPAC is in the lead of a project to improve Outcome Harvesting as an Monitoring & Evaluation (M&E) approach and to be or become suitable and reliable for Monitoring and Evaluation of the Strategic Partnership projects (Dialogue & Dissent policy framework of the Dutch MFA). GPPAC arranged that key partners became actively involved in the second workshop on improving practices in Outcome Harvesting on 24 April 2018. The registration of participants will include key staff of the MFA in M&E, Partos as co-organiser, Strategic Partnership Alliances and NGOs, and OH experts and experienced OH facilitators.

title.narrative: Baseline analyses in the 6 priority Regions of GPPAC for the Prevention up Front Alliance, resulting in the implementation of an adapted Programme Document 2017-2020

description.narrative: In 2016 GPPAC implemented a baseline analysis in the 6 Priority Regions of GPPAC that fall under the financial scheme of the Prevention up Front Alliance. In 2017 this has been implemented for Planning, Monitoring and Evaluation (PME) purposes by 6 Regional operational plans and 1 global operational plan for the global priorities. This is an overall, cross-cutting output without indicators to measure progress.
